notable_incidents: Named after Aurora, Colorado by President Trump during visit
Originally planned large-scale raid cancelled due to media leaks in February 2025
Pre-dawn raids on Aurora and Denver apartment buildings
Colorado Springs nightclub raid resulted in dozens of arrests
Only 36% of those arrested had criminal records

statistics.notes: Thousands arrested statewide, majority without violent criminal convictions

notable_incidents: Preceded Operation Patriot 2.0
Vast majority of detainees in New Bedford had no violent criminal convictions

statistics.notes: More than 600 had significant criminal convictions or pending charges

notable_incidents: Multi-agency surge operation lasting nearly a month
Targeted criminals including rapists, child abusers, drug traffickers
Named follow-up to successful Operation Patriot in May

statistics.notes: Described as 'largest immigration enforcement operation ever carried out' by DHS

target_groups: Gang members including Vice Lord Nation, Gangster Disciples
notable_incidents: Largest single-city immigration enforcement operation in modern US history
Two US citizens killed during operation: Renée Good and Alex Pretti
Federal judge issued injunction against retaliation on peaceful protesters (January 16, 2026)
ACLU of Minnesota filed class-action lawsuit (Tincher et al. v. Noem et al.) on December 17, 2025
Mayor Jacob Frey accused operation of discriminating based on ethnicity
Data showed some individuals listed as arrested were transferred before December 1, 2025

legal_challenges.case_name: Tincher et al. v. Noem et al.
legal_challenges.ruling: Federal agents barred from retaliating against peaceful protesters

statistics.notes: Named in honor of Katie Abraham, killed by undocumented drunk driver

notable_incidents: Silverio Villegas-Gonzalez fatally shot by federal agents
US citizen 'Angel' detained by Border Patrol, later released
Hanover Park police officer Radule Bojovic detained despite valid work authorization
Judge Jeffrey Cummings ruled 22 arrests violated Castañon Nava consent decree
Judge April Perry temporarily blocked National Guard deployment on October 9, 2025
Schools went on lockdown during raids near Frederick Stock Public School
Tear gas used on protesters

Facilities in Wisconsin, Indiana, Kentucky, Texas, Missouri, Kansas, Louisiana, Oklahoma, Arizona, New Mexico

legal_challenges.ruling: 22 arrests found illegal - made without warrants

statistics.notes: Named after 'salvation' of CBP officer who survived shooting

CBP officer shot in face and forearm by two Trinitarios gang members
Miguel Mora Nunez (21) and Christhian Aybar-Berroa (22) charged in shooting
Announced by DHS Secretary Kristi Noem on January 8, 2026
Announcement came one day after ICE agent killed Renee Good in Minneapolis

statistics.notes: 100+ arrests in first three days as of January 23, 2026

target_groups: Crimes involving public safety and child welfare
notable_incidents: Name criticized as 'dehumanizing game of sport'
Governor Janet Mills called ICE agents 'secret police'
Downtown Lewiston reported empty, businesses closed due to fear
Rally of 1,000 people in Lewiston on January 24, 2026
Assistant DHS Secretary singled out Governor Mills for criticism

operations.operation_name: Los Angeles Immigration Raids / Operation Excalibur

statistics.notes: Major June 6, 2025 raids sparked massive protests

target_groups: Day laborers at Home Depot parking lots
notable_incidents: June 6, 2025: Ambiance Apparel facilities raided in tactical gear
Military-style operations with armored vehicles and drones
California National Guard federalized - 2,000 members deployed
Additional 2,000 National Guard and 700 Marines deployed
July 7, 2025: Operation Excalibur at MacArthur Park with US 1-18th Cavalry
Ninth Circuit ruled broad racial profiling unconstitutional on August 1, 2025
ACLU filed Vasquez Perdomo v. Noem on July 2, 2025

legal_challenges.ruling: Broad profile used by ICE does not supply reasonable suspicion for detentive stops

statistics.notes: Florida leads nation with 295 active 287(g) agreements

Central Florida weeklong operation September 22-26, 2025 yielded 400+ arrests
Construction site raid near Tallahassee with Florida Highway Patrol and FDLE

statistics.notes: Largest single-site worksite enforcement action according to DHS

target_groups: Construction workers at Hyundai battery plant
notable_incidents: Criminal search warrant executed based on employer violations
Only 4 individuals were actual targets in warrant
Detained workers taken to Folkston ICE Processing Center
Plant was largest economic development project in Georgia history
Touted by Governor Brian Kemp

nyc_detainer_increase.notes: Over 400% spike in ICE detainers in sanctuary NYC

sanctuary_violations.description: ICE entered NYC shelters without judicial warrants, violating sanctuary laws
NYPD officer found to have violated sanctuary laws by accepting DHS request to flag deportation targets

legislative_actions.bill_name: Stop Dangerous Sanctuary Cities Act of 2025
legislative_actions.description: Block federal funding for sanctuary jurisdictions
Bans sanctuary cities and mandates cooperation with federal immigration authorities

court_order_defiance.description: Federal limits on ICE officers' ability to arrest without warrants or probable cause
court_order_defiance.ice_response: ICE officials suggested they were no longer bound by agreement despite clear language
court_order_defiance.ruling: Judge ruled 22 Chicago arrests violated the decree

court_order_defiance.description: Injunction against federal agents detaining or retaliating against peaceful protesters
court_order_defiance.ruling: Preliminary injunction granted barring use of pepper spray, tear gas against peaceful demonstrators

court_order_defiance.description: Todd Lyons memo authorized ICE agents to forcibly enter homes without judicial warrant
court_order_defiance.status: Policy implemented, described as 'sharp reversal of longstanding guidance'

court_order_defiance.description: Federal judge ordered stop to ICE courthouse arrests

cooperative_states.legislation: SB 8 (2025) - Mandates sheriffs in large counties to collaborate with ICE
cooperative_states.requirement: Counties with 100,000+ residents must partner with ICE under 287(g)

cooperative_states.notes: Leads nation in 287(g) agreements, more than 3x Texas

cooperative_states.legislation: State law mandating law enforcement agencies enter 287(g) agreements

resistant_states.legislation: SB 54 (2017) - Restricts use of state/local resources for federal immigration enforcement
resistant_states.notes: For every 20 local facility arrests in Texas, less than 1 in California

resistant_states.response: Governor and Minneapolis Mayor criticized Operation Metro Surge

resistant_states.governor_response: Governor Janet Mills called ICE agents 'secret police'

TFM.description: Task Force Model - allows enforcement during routine police activity

reimbursement_program.coverage: Full annual salary and benefits for each eligible 287(g) officer
reimbursement_program.performance_awards: Quarterly monetary awards for successful location of targets

notable_partnerships.notes: 13th police force in New Hampshire to sign ICE cooperation agreement
City Council unanimously voted AGAINST ICE partnership proposal

activities: Organizing to prevent Dallas police ICE cooperation

sensitive_locations_policy.previous_policy: 2011 memo directing officers to avoid arrests at schools, hospitals, churches, synagogues, mosques, funeral sites, weddings, marches, rallies
sensitive_locations_policy.new_policy: Immigration officials can now raid churches and schools to arrest undocumented immigrants
sensitive_locations_policy.safeguard: Secondary supervisor approval required before action at schools (expected to be 'extremely rare')

incidents.description: Border Patrol agents detained man working near Frederick Stock Public School
Schools went on lockdown after reports of ICE activity nearby

notable_controversies.description: Mayor arrested on trespassing charges outside detention center during congressional tour attempt
notable_controversies.outcome: Charges dropped after 10 days, judge admonished prosecutors
